course.subject: CSC
course.title: Research Methods
course.catalogDescription: The purpose of this course is to equip ITAA students with the professional skills to understand and to stay current at the technological development through studying research in a specific area of IT. Students will learn to (1) identify and analyze research articles from reliable sources, including reputable conference proceedings and journals, (2) document past and current research into a coherent body of literature, and (3) communicate with fellow IT participants to convey knowledge in oral and written forms.

objectives.objective: Understand the basics of research, including its definition, purpose and expected outcomes
Apprehend the empirical research process and its stages such as identifying research problems, deducing hypotheses, prototyping, designing experiments and publishing results
Conduct literature survey using digital resources
Identify and critically analyze research articles
Evaluate credibility of sources, where research articles are published
Keep track of the technological development by maintaining an update-to-date annotated bibliography and a survey paper

Communicate, in professional settings, with fellow IT participants about the landscape of an IT area, including information such as goals, a progress of technological development, and open (unsolved) problems

outline.topic: The Basics of Reading Research Articles Students read research articles and apprehend the materials in the same way as how they read conventional Computer Science textbooks
Reading Research Articles as a Professional Writing paper reviews Critically analyzing research articles Assessing impacts and contributions of published research
Identifying information of various research stages from research articles
Literature Survey Writing an annotated bibliography Writing a survey paper Presenting a literature survey
